definitions: the act of rising from the dead or returning to life after death
a renewal, revival, or restoration of something that was dormant, inactive, or declining
examples: Christians celebrate the resurrection of Jesus on Easter Sunday
The resurrection story forms the foundation of Christian faith and hope
The band's resurrection after ten years surprised their longtime fans
The neighborhood experienced a resurrection through community development initiatives

definitions: a grilled sandwich made with corned beef, Swiss cheese, sauerkraut, and dressing on rye bread
a male given name of Hebrew origin meaning 'behold, a son'
examples: He ordered a classic reuben sandwich at the Jewish delicatessen
The restaurant's reuben comes with homemade thousand island dressing
Reuben was the eldest son of Jacob in biblical accounts
Her grandfather Reuben emigrated from Eastern Europe in 1920

definitions: a divine truth or divine will made known through supernatural means or religious experience
a surprising and previously unknown fact that has been disclosed or discovered
examples: The Book of Revelation contains prophetic visions about the end times
Many believers consider scripture to be divine revelation from God
The documents were a revelation about the company's hidden practices
Her talent for singing was a revelation to everyone at karaoke

definitions: a title of respect used before the name of a member of the clergy, especially Protestant ministers
examples: Reverend Johnson delivered an inspiring sermon about community service today
The congregation invited Reverend Smith to lead their new church
The reverend visited sick members of the parish every Tuesday afternoon
Several reverends gathered for the interfaith dialogue on social justice

definitions: the Latin word for king, used in titles and formal references to reigning male monarchs
a male given name, often used for dogs as well as people
examples: The coin bore the inscription 'George Rex' for King George
In legal cases, Rex versus Smith indicates the Crown as prosecutor
Their German Shepherd named Rex won best in show yesterday
Rex Harrison starred in My Fair Lady on Broadway

definitions: edible starchy cereal grain that is the staple food for large parts of the world's population
a surname of Welsh origin, also associated with former U.S. Secretary of State Condoleezza Rice
examples: They served fragrant jasmine rice with the Thai curry dish
Rice cultivation requires flooded fields during the growing season
Secretary Rice negotiated several important international agreements during her tenure
The Rice family has lived in this town for generations

definitions: a white grape variety originating from Germany, or the aromatic white wine made from these grapes
examples: The German riesling paired perfectly with the spicy Asian cuisine
This dry riesling exhibits notes of peach and citrus flavors
Riesling grapes thrive in cool climate regions around the world
She ordered a glass of sweet riesling for dessert

definitions: a short repeated phrase in popular music, typically used as an introduction or refrain in songs
an amusing or interesting verbal comment or improvisation on a particular subject or theme
examples: The guitar riff from that song has been stuck in my head
He played the opening riff of Smoke on the Water
The comedian's riff on modern technology had everyone laughing loudly
She went on a long riff about the challenges of parenting

definitions: the brightest star in the constellation Orion and the seventh brightest star in the night sky
examples: Rigel appears as a brilliant blue-white star in Orion's foot
Astronomers classify Rigel as a blue supergiant star system
Navigation by Rigel helped ancient sailors cross the southern seas
The name Rigel comes from Arabic meaning 'foot of Orion'

definitions: the Spanish and Portuguese word for river, used in many place names throughout Latin America
short form referring to Rio de Janeiro, a major city in Brazil
examples: The Rio Grande forms a natural border between Texas and Mexico
Many settlements developed along the Rio Negro in the Amazon
The Olympics were held in Rio during the summer of 2016
Carnival in Rio attracts millions of tourists every February

definitions: a wine-producing region in northern Spain, or the red and white wines produced in this region
examples: This aged rioja displays complex flavors of vanilla and leather
The restaurant specializes in Spanish cuisine with an extensive rioja selection
Rioja wines must meet strict aging requirements for their classification
They visited several bodegas in Rioja during their Spanish vacation

definitions: a luxury hotel chain founded by CÃ©sar Ritz, known for opulent accommodations and service
ostentatious display of elegance, luxury, or wealth in style or manner
examples: They celebrated their anniversary at the Ritz in Paris
The Ritz Carlton offers five-star service and amenities worldwide
She put on the ritz for her dinner party last night
The gala was pure ritz with champagne and caviar everywhere

definitions: the ground or area along the bank or edge of a river
examples: They built their cabin on the peaceful riverside near town
The riverside park offers walking trails and picnic areas
Development along the riverside has increased property values significantly
Wildlife thrives in the protected riverside habitat

definitions: a coastal region with a subtropical climate, especially the Mediterranean coast of southeastern France and northwestern Italy
examples: They spent their honeymoon touring the French Riviera in style
The Italian Riviera attracts millions of tourists every summer season
Monaco sits along the Riviera between France and Italy
Property prices on the Riviera remain among Europe's highest

definitions: solid mineral material forming part of the earth's crust, often used as building material
a genre of popular music originating in the 1950s, characterized by strong beats and electric instruments
a gentle backwards and forwards or side to side movement
examples: The geologist examined the volcanic rock for mineral content
They used local rock to build the garden wall
Classic rock stations still play Beatles and Rolling Stones regularly
The rock concert sold out within minutes of tickets going on sale
The boat's gentle rock helped the baby fall asleep
She loves to rock in her grandmother's old rocking chair

definitions: a unit of measurement for exposure to ionizing radiation, named after Wilhelm Roentgen
reference to Wilhelm Conrad Roentgen, German physicist who discovered X-rays in 1895
examples: The radiation exposure measured fifty roentgens near the reactor
Medical X-rays typically deliver less than one roentgen of exposure
Roentgen received the first Nobel Prize in Physics in 1901
The roentgen ray was the original term for X-ray

definitions: relating to ancient Rome, its empire, or its people and culture
an upright typeface used in ordinary print, as distinguished from italic
a citizen or native of modern Rome or ancient Rome
examples: Roman architecture influenced building design throughout the Western world
The Roman Empire lasted for over a thousand years
This text is printed in roman rather than italic font
Publishers typically use roman type for body text
Ancient Roman citizens enjoyed special legal rights and privileges
Modern Romans take pride in their city's historical significance

definitions: a feeling of excitement and mystery associated with love, or a love affair
a genre of fiction dealing with romantic love, adventure, or mysterious and remote settings
languages that developed from Latin, including French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, and Romanian
examples: Their whirlwind romance began during a trip to Venice
The romance faded after years of marriage and routine
She reads romance novels to escape from daily stress
Medieval romance literature featured knights and noble quests
Romance languages share similar grammatical structures and vocabulary roots
Students can choose to study any Romance language for credit

definitions: a style of architecture that flourished in Europe from the 9th to 12th centuries, characterized by round arches and massive stone walls
examples: The cathedral's romanesque arches date back to the eleventh century
Romanesque architecture preceded the Gothic style in medieval Europe
The museum features an impressive collection of romanesque sculptures
Pilgrimage churches often displayed romanesque architectural elements

definitions: a native or citizen of Romania, or relating to Romania and its people
the official language of Romania, a Romance language with Slavic influences
examples: The Romanian delegation presented their proposal at the EU meeting
Romanian culture blends Latin, Slavic, and Byzantine influences
She's learning Romanian to communicate with her husband's family
Romanian uses the Latin alphabet with several additional diacritical marks

definitions: an artistic, literary, and intellectual movement originating in late 18th century Europe, emphasizing emotion, individualism, and nature over reason and classical forms
examples: Romanticism revolutionized poetry through writers like Wordsworth and Coleridge
The painting exemplifies romanticism with its dramatic landscapes and emotions
Musical romanticism featured composers like Chopin and Liszt
Romanticism rejected the rationalism of the Enlightenment period

definitions: the male protagonist in Shakespeare's tragedy Romeo and Juliet, a young man who dies for love
a man who is passionate about romance or considered an ardent lover
examples: Romeo declares his love for Juliet in the famous balcony scene
The actor playing Romeo must convey both passion and youth
He's quite the romeo, always writing poetry for his girlfriends
The office romeo finally settled down and got married

definitions: a psychological test using inkblot patterns to assess personality characteristics and emotional functioning through interpretation of ambiguous stimuli
examples: The psychologist administered a Rorschach test during the clinical evaluation
Rorschach inkblots reveal unconscious thoughts through projection
His abstract painting looked like a giant Rorschach test
The debate became a political Rorschach for partisan viewpoints

definitions: a city in New Mexico, United States, known for ranching and military facilities
site of an alleged UFO crash in 1947 that became central to UFO conspiracy theories
examples: Roswell serves as the county seat of Chaves County, New Mexico
The military base near Roswell tested weather balloons and classified projects
The Roswell incident sparked decades of UFO speculation and theories
Tourists visit Roswell specifically for its UFO museum and attractions

definitions: a person who supports the principle of monarchy or a particular royal dynasty, especially during times of political conflict
examples: Royalists fought against parliamentarians during the English Civil War
The royalist faction supported the restoration of the monarchy
Modern royalists celebrate royal weddings and jubilees with enthusiasm
The newspaper takes a strongly royalist editorial position

definitions: a point of no return or a decisive, irrevocable step, from Julius Caesar crossing the Rubicon river to start civil war
examples: Declaring independence was their Rubicon in the revolutionary struggle
Once you sign that contract, you've crossed the Rubicon
The company crossed the Rubicon when it went public
Publishing those documents was his personal Rubicon with the establishment

definitions: a sudden quick movement toward something or somewhere, or the act of hurrying
a sudden strong demand for something or a period of intense activity
a grasslike marsh plant with cylindrical stems, used for weaving and thatching
examples: The morning rush to catch the train left her breathless
There was a mad rush for the exits when the alarm sounded
The gold rush brought thousands of prospectors to California
The holiday rush keeps retail workers busy through December
Rushes grow abundantly in the wetlands near the river
They wove baskets from dried rushes and willow branches

definitions: Mount Rushmore, a mountain in South Dakota featuring carved faces of four U.S. presidents: Washington, Jefferson, Roosevelt, and Lincoln
examples: Mount Rushmore attracts over two million visitors each year
The Rushmore sculptures took fourteen years to complete
Rushmore represents American democracy and presidential leadership to many
Native Americans view Rushmore as a desecration of sacred land

definitions: a native or citizen of Russia, or relating to Russia and its people, culture, or history
the East Slavic language spoken in Russia and several former Soviet republics
examples: Russian literature includes masterworks by Tolstoy and Dostoevsky
The Russian delegation voted against the proposed resolution
She studied Russian for five years to read Pushkin in the original
Russian uses the Cyrillic alphabet with thirty-three letters

definitions: a white crystalline substance consisting mainly of sodium chloride, used for seasoning and preserving food
any chemical compound formed from the reaction of an acid with a base
examples: Please pass the salt and pepper for the potatoes
Too much salt in your diet can raise blood pressure
The chemistry student identified various salts in the laboratory experiment
Epsom salt is actually magnesium sulfate, not sodium chloride

definitions: Small Computer System Interface, a set of standards for physically connecting computers to peripheral devices like hard drives
examples: The old server uses SCSI drives for data storage
SCSI cables can connect multiple devices in a daisy chain
Modern systems have largely replaced SCSI with SATA and USB connections
The SCSI controller card needs proper termination to function correctly

definitions: a fish-eating marine mammal with flippers and streamlined body, living partly on land and in water
a device or substance used to close, secure, or make something watertight or airtight
an official mark, emblem, or symbol used to authenticate documents or indicate approval
examples: Harbor seals basked on the rocks during low tide
The seal pups learn to swim within weeks of birth
Check the rubber seal around the refrigerator door for damage
Apply silicone seal around the bathtub to prevent water leaks
The document bore the official seal of the state
The president's seal appears on all official correspondence

definitions: informal abbreviation for second, a unit of time
Securities and Exchange Commission, the U.S. federal agency regulating the stock market
examples: Wait just a sec while I grab my jacket
The race was won by only a few secs
The SEC investigated the company for insider trading violations
All public companies must file regular reports with the SEC

definitions: the external form, outline, or configuration of something, especially its geometric properties
the physical condition or fitness level of a person or thing
examples: The architect designed the building in an unusual triangular shape
Children learn to identify basic shapes like circles and squares
She's in excellent shape after months of marathon training
The old car is still in pretty good shape considering its age

definitions: a convulsive catching of breath while crying, or the sound made when crying heavily
examples: Her sobs could be heard through the closed bedroom door
He tried to speak between sobs after hearing the news
The child's loud sobs attracted the attention of concerned passersby
She stifled a sob during the emotional movie scene

definitions: grass and the surface layer of earth held together by grass roots, used for lawns
British slang term for an unpleasant or contemptible person
examples: They laid fresh sod to create an instant lawn
The sod was carefully rolled and watered after installation
The poor sod lost his job just before Christmas
Don't be such a miserable sod about everything

definitions: something given or done to pacify or placate someone, often seen as inadequate
a piece of bread or food soaked in liquid
examples: The small raise was just a sop to keep employees from quitting
The committee's recommendations were dismissed as a sop to critics
He dipped a sop of bread into the hearty stew
Medieval diners often ate sops soaked in wine or broth

definitions: Sun Protection Factor, a measure of how effectively a sunscreen protects skin from ultraviolet radiation
examples: Dermatologists recommend using sunscreen with at least SPF 30 daily
The SPF 50 lotion provides high protection against sunburn
Higher SPF numbers indicate greater protection from UV rays
Reapply SPF sunscreen every two hours when swimming or sweating

definitions: Selective Serotonin Reuptake Inhibitor, a class of antidepressant drugs that increase serotonin levels in the brain
examples: The doctor prescribed an SSRI to treat her clinical depression
Common SSRI medications include fluoxetine and sertraline
SSRIs typically take several weeks to show therapeutic effects
Patients should not stop taking SSRIs without medical supervision

definitions: sexually transmitted disease, an infection passed from person to person through sexual contact
examples: Regular STD testing is important for sexually active individuals
The clinic offers confidential STD screening and treatment services
Education about STD prevention reduces transmission rates among teenagers
Many STDs can be treated effectively with appropriate antibiotics

definitions: Sport Utility Vehicle, a large vehicle designed for both on-road and off-road use with high ground clearance
examples: The family bought an SUV for their camping trips
SUVs offer more cargo space than traditional sedans
Fuel-efficient hybrid SUVs have become increasingly popular recently
The SUV's four-wheel drive handled the snowy conditions well

definitions: indigenous people inhabiting the Arctic regions of Norway, Sweden, Finland, and Russia's Kola Peninsula, traditionally reindeer herders
examples: The Saami parliament represents indigenous interests in Nordic countries
Traditional Saami culture includes distinctive handicrafts and joik singing
Saami languages belong to the Finno-Ugric language family
Many Saami still practice traditional reindeer herding today

definitions: a day of religious observance and rest from work, kept by Jews from Friday evening to Saturday evening, and by Christians on Sunday
examples: Orthodox Jews strictly observe the Sabbath from sunset Friday
The Sabbath provides time for worship and family togetherness
Some businesses close on the Sabbath for religious reasons
Breaking the Sabbath was considered a serious offense historically

definitions: a hollow, flexible structure resembling a bag or pouch in an animal or plant, containing fluid or air
examples: The surgeon removed the fluid-filled sac during the procedure
The egg sac contained hundreds of tiny spider eggs
Air sacs in bird lungs help them breathe efficiently
The pollen sac burst, releasing clouds of yellow pollen

definitions: the world's largest hot desert, covering most of North Africa across multiple countries
examples: The Sahara Desert spans over nine million square kilometers
Nomadic tribes have crossed the Sahara for thousands of years
Sahara temperatures can exceed 50 degrees Celsius during summer
The Sahara was once a green savanna thousands of years ago

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the Sahara Desert or the regions around it
examples: Saharan dust storms can travel across the Atlantic Ocean
The Saharan climate is characterized by extreme temperature variations
Sub-Saharan Africa refers to regions south of the desert
Saharan rock art provides evidence of ancient civilizations

definitions: the former name of Ho Chi Minh City, the largest city in Vietnam, used until 1976
examples: Saigon fell to North Vietnamese forces in April 1975
Many older Vietnamese still refer to the city as Saigon
The evacuation of Saigon marked the end of the Vietnam War
French colonial architecture still stands in old Saigon districts

definitions: a large edible fish that migrates from the sea to fresh water to spawn
a pink-orange color resembling the flesh of salmon fish
examples: Wild salmon swim upstream to spawn in their natal rivers
Grilled salmon provides healthy omega-3 fatty acids
She painted the nursery walls a soft salmon color
The salmon dress complemented her skin tone perfectly

definitions: a compassionate person who helps others in distress, from the biblical parable of the Good Samaritan
a member of an ancient people of Samaria, or their modern descendants in Israel and Palestine
examples: A good samaritan stopped to help the accident victims
The Samaritan organization provides crisis counseling by phone
The parable of the Good Samaritan teaches about compassion
Modern Samaritans still practice their ancient religious traditions

definitions: alternative spelling of Saami, the indigenous people of northern Scandinavia and northwestern Russia
examples: Sami reindeer herders follow traditional migration routes each year
The Sami flag features bright colors representing their culture
Sami handicrafts are protected by cultural heritage laws
Young Sami learn their ancestral language in special schools
